description: Academic writing: clarity, cohesion, argument structure, and revision methodology for reader-centered prose.

topics.name: Clarity as Reader Experience
coreClaims: Clarity improves when subjects name the main actors and verbs name the main actions.
Nominalizations can be useful but often hide action; use intentionally.
practice: Rewrite 5 sentences by restoring action to verbs.
Add a 'who does what' pass to a paragraph.

topics.name: Cohesion and Flow
coreClaims: Readers track familiar information before new information; sentence openings matter.
Paragraphs should have a visible controlling idea and a logical sequence of support.
practice: Add topic-stringing (consistent terms) across a paragraph.
Create a reverse outline and repair structure.

topics.name: Revision Protocol (Deterministic)
protocol: Step 4: Diagnose paragraph logic (claim → evidence → warrant).
